intro: Scrophularia olympica var. bordzilowskii, commonly known as the Olympic scrophularia, is a rare and endemic plant found primarily in the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
